abstract.p: All phones, fax machines, pagers and computer modem lines, with exception of current cell phones, will switch from 915 to 845 area codes in New York's Putnam, Rockland, Dutchess, Orange and Ulster counties and parts of other counties effective June 5 (M)

block.p: If you live in Putnam County and feel terribly attached to the 914 area code, owning a cellular phone is your only lifeline as of tomorrow.

Beyond that, all phones and fax machines, all pagers and computer modem lines in Putnam, Rockland, Dutchess, Orange and Ulster Counties will be switched over to a new area code: 845. Parts of Sullivan, Delaware, Greene and Columbia Counties will also be affected.
Only Westchester will stay 914. But there's one exception: current wireless phones -- wherever they may roam -- will keep the 914 designation, even if the user lives outside Westchester.
If you live in Putnam County and feel terribly attached to the 914 area code, owning a cellular phone is your only lifeline as of tomorrow.

Beyond that, all phones and fax machines, all pagers and computer modem lines in Putnam, Rockland, Dutchess, Orange and Ulster Counties will be switched over to a new area code: 845. Parts of Sullivan, Delaware, Greene and Columbia Counties will also be affected.
Only Westchester will stay 914. But there's one exception: current wireless phones -- wherever they may roam -- will keep the 914 designation, even if the user lives outside Westchester.

A glut in the 914 market prompted the move, caused by competition among telecommunication providers for home and business customers and by the sheer need for more numbers in a frantically expanding age of technology.

''A family 10 years ago may have had one or two lines for numbers associated with that family,'' Cliff Lee, a spokesman for Bell Atlantic, said. ''You now may have six or seven or eight lines associated with that family.''
There will be a six-month grace period for callers who keep dialing 914, David C. Flanagan, a Public Service Commission spokesman, said. After early December though, you're on your own.
